answers.answer: Hello,Menstrual irregularities can occur at various times of the cycle for various reasons.  it is often difficult in the immediate moment to know the underlying cause.  It is usually the case that with the benefit of time, and having the opportunity to observe patterns, similarities, etc, irregular bleeding can be sorted out.  Keep a menstrual diary for the next 2-3 months documenting the days you bleed/spot and how much (# of pads/tampons used) and present that to your physician if an irregular pattern persists.Best of luck,Dr. Downing

question: hi im 37 yrs had 7 pregnancys 6 living ,menstrual cycle was iregular pre marraige, after all births became normal 26 day and lasts 7 days my husband had a vasectomy 3 yrs ago now ive missed a period and im worried i would just like to know whats wrong? could i be starting menopause, i had diabetes on last 3 babies insulin on last baby, menstrual cycle was every 26 days with no problems this is very unusual for me please help?
title: worried
